title: Ok riot, lets face the music.
body:
The pre-season is terrible, you know it, we know it, so lets just know when we're beat, swallow our pride and reverse/fix it.

games are just random now, i have massive lane pressure for the first 12 minutes I'm always pushed right to his tower, me and my minions are attacking the tower as often as possible, he has to recall frequently, and dies just as frequently then around the 13ish minute mark, i slip up once, die and he (an AP) takes my turret from full HP to zero. how is that play/strategy?? and this happens all the time.

Sometimes teams snowball so much they are just an impenetrable wall (and this happens at under 20 minutes)

and other times they are demolishing us for 95% of the game, and then make one slip up and we win (even though we spent the whole game making mistakes and they made just 1) where is the play and strategy in that?

everything just feels like it happens at random now...

replies.body: As already mentioned, the pre-season is for testing new features. The patches and changes will come. This game is constantly evolving, but pre-season is when the big changes happen. Fixing them takes time. Provide your feedback to Riot, then sit back and be patient and wait for them to make the changes needed. There is so much more that goes into changing features, I wouldn't even be able to get my head around the number of team members and time it would take.

The problem is that some changes riot is like "yea its a problem" and a year later they're like "yup, still a problem"
like vayne, she has been in every 3rd game the whole season and still is and riot even said that its a problem, yet they haven't done anything, the marksman changes just made it worse, thats why i have no faith in just sitting back waiting.

Have you tried the Poro King mode? 6 minutes we are sitting at their last 2 towers unable to do anything because we pushed them so hard so early that we are not yet strong enough to actually advance further. We need to actually die to spend our money to push the last bit.

It is all terrible all over, you get players who, like yourself, constantly push the enemy under their tower, can't take the tower, yet when you die you lose your lane instantly.

The balance from laning to mid game and onwards needs to be fixed something shocking, you can't be having a stale mate for 10 minutes and than lose 3 towers in 3 minutes, it makes no sense.
It does make no sense, that you are pushed for 12 minutes and accomplish nothing then die once and BOOM lane gone :(

I get what you mean about the towers, i had a game yesterday where i was playing Mundo (Full tank) and i was able to do 300+ damage to towers every auto attack for 5 seconds simply by activating my E (At LvL16) i was doing significantly more damage to the towers, inhibs and nexus than our ADC and Mid laner (Zed). 

I agree this Pre-Season has been somewhat unbalanced, the changes to Rageblade and the Masteries pretty much brought hybrids back into the game and hybrids have been dominating everything in this Pre-Season so far, Rammus, Trundle and Mundo have come back into play this Pre-season too with the buffs to Mundo along with the mastery changes, new items/ item changes and tower changes making them super strong. 

The Miss Fortune + Janna, Soraka, Sona or Nami combo is pretty broken at the moment but people tend to be sheep and mostly play Vayne because she's seen as a "hyper carry" even though MF can completely out trade and demolish her 1v1 (Had a game yesterday where i was playing MF + Janna against Vayne + Anivia and Vayne couldn't even trade with me, i was forcing her out of lane nonstop by getting her low and at one point she was 3 levels behind) So Miss fortune is pretty devastating at the moment, if you main ADC you'll already know she's considered freelo. But something does need to be done about these champions A.S.A.P , Vayne, Yasuo, Lee Sin and Brand, are spammed almost every game and it get's annoying, people jumping on the trend train and playing them because they're considered to be "Hyper carries" are the worst. 

But in saying all that, it is the pre-season after all so you can't really expect much, massive changes have been made to the game so naturally one broken thing leads to another and i'm sure you realize by now that this game will never be balanced. 

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
mf is so broken atm. cc you and thats a free 4k damage in 3 seconds on her ult. and her poke in lane is so bs, 350 damage in 1 hit at lv 1? wtf are you thinking rito
Yea its shit, the turrets are stupid....
Is pre-season terrible? No. Could it be improved? Yes.
its been out for quite a few patches so far and I'm still waiting.

the whole point of pre season is to experiment with new features and updates on live before the season starts ofc its all gonna be hectic a lot of changes came out and its very rare that new features added will be balanced upon release.   its only because there have been so many changes during this time that it seems so wild
Yet the pre-season has been out for a long time and no drastic countermeasures have been taken.
I haven't had any wierd as random moments so far this Pre, I think it's great. It's bringing the game in a new way, bringing out new meta champions (I haven't even seen Vayne in a while).

Minions need to be fixed, and snowball reduced by turning back towards the old snowball potential.

The second one will definitely happen. Rioters have already said they are not happy with 20 minutes being the standard, they want the 40 minutes back.
They're also not happy with dragon being almost ignored, same with rift herald and baron.
As it currently stands an outer turret is worth more than Dragon or Rift Herald.
Most teams will only actively go for first dragon, and then only take subsequent dragons in order to keep first dragon from the enemy team.

It should also be noted that people hate on the pre-season patches every year, but quickly get over it and play on. How about people just stop complaining about feature they know will stay?

Minions do need to be fixed, if you get slowed in or even near a minion wave its just a snare. (GG Nasus)

the main problem i have with the pre-season is that before the 12 minute mark you cant do shit to turrets even if your lane is pushed the whole time and as soon as it hits 12/13 min AD champs just melt them like butter, i think there needs to be more reward for having your lane permanently pushed because its a viable strategy for pushing turrets if you're champ isn't the 'all in kill the enemy' type champ, yet it just is just impractical to do atm, it has all the risks of being ganked etc but it needs some reward.

and the ignoring of dragon is annoying, every time i jungle I'm forced to solo it because no one can be fucked, and tbh i just give up on rift herald, you cant solo it and no one wants to miss their precious 2 minions while they come help with it.

im not complaining about features i know will stay because I'm hoping that my complaining will help to remove them.
and this is the first pre-season i have ever complained about, not because its all different and I'm scared of change and all that, but because i genuinely think it inhibits the game.
